Description: Terracotta figure of leaf or ear (?). Small leaf-shaped sculpture, red, bottom has tapered end and deep cup at base, spike for insertion into a socket at one end, possibly a Hathor ear (?). Handmade (?) and sold. Traces of white coating or slip. Red-brown Nile silt fabric, with abundant mica.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DD.216) (Phase 3)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.5833 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
